acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: The value of 0.02mg/L was found in the inhalation LC50 data in which the animal and time of exposure was unknown (RTECS (2004)), it was considered as dust inhalation "category 1". Data that human LC50 (?): 0.005mg/L was also in the same former literature.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Steam inhalation cannot be performed because it is a nonvolatile solid.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Since data of 570mg/kg (RTECS (2004)) and 1026mg/kg (ACGIH (2001)) were found in rat LD50, they were set as Category 4.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Although it is a caustic substances to the extent that it can be storaged only with the container of silver or platinum (Sittig (47th, 2002)), the corrosion-rate data about steel and aluminum are not obtained. It is estimated to be in Category 1.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Although it contains oxygen, cesium is the most stable metal in the state of monovalence, and does not give oxygen to other substances.

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

respiratory_sensitizer.rationale: There were no data and we could not classify it.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: It is indicated that puting into the eyes of the rabbit causes the intense stimulus (ACGIH (2001)), and into people's eyes also causes stimulating and burns  (Sitting (47th.2002), HSFS (1998)). Moreover, since skin corrosivity and irritation were set to "Category 1", eyes were also set as "Category 1".

skin_corrosion_irritation.hazard_statement: Causes severe skin burns and eye damage
skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: There are Mild reports when it attaches to the skin of a rabbit in the state of the dry crystal (RTECS (2004)). But it indicates significant corrosive (ACGIH (2001)) when it is absorbed moisture, or in aqueous solutions. So it was set as Category 1. The warnings and the cautions about corrosion behavior for humans are also indicated by individual references (ACGIH (2001), HSFS (1998), Sitting (47th, 2002)). It is referred to as class 8PG II in the U.N. transportation advice. GHS Category for the purpose of transportation is set as 1B.

skin_sensitizer.rationale: We classified it as "Out Of Category" since we have a report (ACGIH (2001)) that skin sensitization was not acknowledged for the experiment with the guinea pigs.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Although it reacts violently with water, what is generated is heat and is not flammable gas. (Sitting (47th. 2002))

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: The influence on the respiratory systems, such as lungs and a trachea, by prolonged exposure of humans is indicated (Sitting (47th.2002) and HSFS (1998)). Moreover, in the two inhalation experiments of rats, effects on the central nervous systems, on heart and blood by the exposure concentration within the guidance value of Category 1 are separately reported (RTECS (2004)), but use was withheld since there was no detailed description.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: No case reports are found that should make us classify it into Category 1 or 2. Sitting (54th, 2002) and HSFS (1998) have the descriptions about stimuli to upper respirators (nose, throat and trachea). Although the description is listed in the data sheet that does not clarify the basis and source, we adopted "Category 3 (respiratory irritant)" since this substance is the strongest alkali.
